title: Spell book
data:
***Version [0.28](/0.28 "0.28")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                 |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | An arcane textbook containing magical spells of unknown origin. |

**Spell books** are [items](/Item "Item") that allow player to [memorise](/Spell_memorisation "Spell memorisation") [spells](/Spell "Spell").

There are two types of spell books: standard ones with a set name and list of spells, and randomly generated ([randart](/Randart "Randart")) books that contain multiple random, but often thematically linked, spells.

## Contents

- [1 General](#General)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Standard books](#Standard_books)
- [4 History](#History)

## General

Spell books are identified automatically on sight. Reading a spell book destroys the book and adds new spells to your spell library. [Djinn](/Djinn "Djinn") are unable to learn spells from spellbooks but destroy the book anyway.

Besides just finding them on the dungeon floor or in [shops](/Shop "Shop"), spell books can be obtained by using [acquirement](/Acquirement "Acquirement") or as [gifts](/Gift "Gift") from [Sif Muna](/Sif_Muna "Sif Muna").

## Strategy

Spell books are not exactly rare, but there are so many different ones out there that finding a specific spell book may be difficult or even impossible in a given game. While book [shops](/Shop "Shop") provide a large, random assortment to choose from, spell books are also generally on the expensive side. Thus, obtaining a specific spell book that you want can be a hassle, but you can alleviate this by worshiping the right [god](/God "God").

[Sif Muna](/Sif_Muna "Sif Muna") grants spell books as [gifts](/Gift "Gift"), which are more likely to be in for a school you've trained in. Regardless, each book will have at least one new spell, so followers will eventually have access to every spell in the game. [Gozag](/Gozag "Gozag")'s Call Merchant may create a bookstore, which have a large number of books (\~8 each). So by sheer numbers, you are likely to receive a useful book. Bookstores can, of course, spawn in the regular dungeon, where Gozag's funds at least help buy them.

[Kikubaaqudgha](/Kikubaaqudgha "Kikubaaqudgha") and [Vehumet](/Vehumet "Vehumet") both provide spells directly instead of via book; specializing in [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy") or [offensive spells](/Conjurations "Conjurations"), respectively.

## Standard books

- *See also: [List of spells by book](/List_of_spells_by_book "List of spells by book")*

* **[Book of Air](/Book_of_Air "Book of Air")**: [Shock](/Shock "Shock"), [Swiftness](/Swiftness "Swiftness"), [Airstrike](/Airstrike "Airstrike")
* **Script error**
* **[Book of Annihilations](/Book_of_Annihilations "Book of Annihilations")**: [Chain Lightning](/Chain_Lightning "Chain Lightning"), [Fire Storm](/Fire_Storm "Fire Storm"), [Shatter](/Shatter "Shatter")
* **[Book of Armaments](/Book_of_Armaments "Book of Armaments")**: [Stone Arrow](/Stone_Arrow "Stone Arrow"), [Animate Armour](/Animate_Armour "Animate Armour"), [Lehudib's Crystal Spear](/Lehudib%27s_Crystal_Spear "Lehudib's Crystal Spear")
* **[Book of Beasts](/Book_of_Beasts "Book of Beasts")**: [Summon Ice Beast](/Summon_Ice_Beast "Summon Ice Beast"), [Summon Mana Viper](/Summon_Mana_Viper "Summon Mana Viper"), [Monstrous Menagerie](/Monstrous_Menagerie "Monstrous Menagerie")
* **[Book of Blasting](/Book_of_Blasting "Book of Blasting")**: [Volatile Blastmotes](/Volatile_Blastmotes "Volatile Blastmotes"), [Fulminant Prism](/Fulminant_Prism "Fulminant Prism"), [Iskenderun's Mystic Blast](/Iskenderun%27s_Mystic_Blast "Iskenderun's Mystic Blast")
* **[Book of Blood](/Book_of_Blood "Book of Blood")**: [Call Imp](/Call_Imp "Call Imp"), [Sublimation of Blood](/Sublimation_of_Blood "Sublimation of Blood"), [Summon Hydra](/Summon_Hydra "Summon Hydra")

* **[Necronomicon](/Necronomicon "Necronomicon")**: [Haunt](/Haunt "Haunt"), [Borgnjor's Revivification](/Borgnjor%27s_Revivification "Borgnjor's Revivification"), [Death's Door](/Death%27s_Door "Death's Door")

* **[There-And-Back Book](/There-And-Back_Book "There-And-Back Book")**: [Teleport Other](/Teleport_Other "Teleport Other"), [Dispersal](/Dispersal "Dispersal"), [Gell's Gavotte](/Gell%27s_Gavotte "Gell's Gavotte")
* **[Trismegistus Codex](/Trismegistus_Codex "Trismegistus Codex")**: [Ignite Poison](/Ignite_Poison "Ignite Poison"), [Freezing Cloud](/Freezing_Cloud "Freezing Cloud")

## History

- [0.29](/0.29 "0.29")
  - Removed [Book of Pain](/Book_of_Pain "Book of Pain").

- [0.28](/0.28 "0.28")
  - Removed [Book of Stone](/Book_of_Stone "Book of Stone").

- [0.27](/0.27 "0.27")

  - Fixed books now only have 2-4 spells each (down from 4-6 each). Randomly generated spellbooks also have fewer spells.
  - Spellbooks generate more frequently and are always identified.
  - 30 new types of fixed book are added.
  - Mage and Warrior-Mage classes start with spells already in their library, rather than a specific spellbook.

- [0.25](/0.25 "0.25")
  - Reworked [Book of Enchantments](/Book_of_Enchantments "Book of Enchantments") into [Book of Hexes](/Book_of_Hexes "Book of Hexes").

- [0.22](/0.22 "0.22")

  - Spell library was introduced.

    - Spells from books are automatically added to a global library upon pickup.
    - Library spells can be memorized from anywhere through the **M** screen.
    - Spellbooks are destroyed after their spells are added to the library.

  - Followers of [Trog](/Trog "Trog") lost the ability to burn spell books on the floor to produce [clouds](/Cloud "Cloud") of flame.

- [0.19](/0.19 "0.19")

  - Removed books: [Akashic Record](/Akashic_Record "Akashic Record"), [Book of Envenomations](/Book_of_Envenomations "Book of Envenomations")
  - Books no longer have to be picked up to be identified
  - Removed the ability to forget a spell by destroying a spell book

- [0.17](/0.17 "0.17")

  - Removed book: [Book of Control](/Book_of_Control "Book of Control")
  - High level spell books no longer restrict learning from them based on skill levels

- [0.16](/0.16 "0.16")

  - Added books: [Akashic Record](/Akashic_Record "Akashic Record"), [Fen Folio](/Fen_Folio "Fen Folio")
  - Removed book: [Book of Wizardry](/Book_of_Wizardry "Book of Wizardry")

- [0.15](/0.15 "0.15")
  - Removed book: [Book of War Chants](/Book_of_War_Chants "Book of War Chants")

- [0.13](/0.13 "0.13")
  - Added books: [Book of Battle](/Book_of_Battle "Book of Battle")

- [0.12](/0.12 "0.12")
  - Removed books: [Book of Morphology](/Book_of_Morphology "Book of Morphology"), [Book of Stalking](/Book_of_Stalking "Book of Stalking")

- Earlier:
  - Removed books: [Book of Tukima](/Book_of_Tukima "Book of Tukima"), [Book of Conjurations (fire+earth)](/Book_of_Conjurations_\(fire%2Bearth\) "Book of Conjurations (fire+earth)"), [Book of Conjurations (ice+air)](/Book_of_Conjurations_\(ice%2Bair\) "Book of Conjurations (ice+air)"), [Book of Charms](/Book_of_Charms "Book of Charms"), [Book of Minor Magic (flame)](/Book_of_Minor_Magic_\(flame\) "Book of Minor Magic (flame)"), [Book of Minor Magic (frost)](/Book_of_Minor_Magic_\(frost\) "Book of Minor Magic (frost)"), [Book of Minor Magic (summ)](/Book_of_Minor_Magic_\(summ\) "Book of Minor Magic (summ)"), [Monster Manual](/Monster_Manual "Monster Manual"), [Book of Brands](/Book_of_Brands "Book of Brands"), [Book of Divinations](/Book_of_Divinations "Book of Divinations"), [Book of Surveyances](/Book_of_Surveyances "Book of Surveyances"), [Book of Practical Magic](/Book_of_Practical_Magic "Book of Practical Magic")
html:
Spell book

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.28: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
An arcane textbook containing magical spells of unknown origin.

Spell books are items that allow player to memorise spells.

There are two types of spell books: standard ones with a set name and list of spells, and randomly generated (randart) books that contain multiple random, but often thematically linked, spells.

Contents

  • 1 General
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Standard books
  • 4 History

General

Spell books are identified automatically on sight. Reading a spell book destroys the book and adds new spells to your spell library. Djinn are unable to learn spells from spellbooks but destroy the book anyway.

Besides just finding them on the dungeon floor or in shops, spell books can be obtained by using acquirement or as gifts from Sif Muna.

Strategy

Spell books are not exactly rare, but there are so many different ones out there that finding a specific spell book may be difficult or even impossible in a given game. While book shops provide a large, random assortment to choose from, spell books are also generally on the expensive side. Thus, obtaining a specific spell book that you want can be a hassle, but you can alleviate this by worshiping the right god.

Sif Muna grants spell books as gifts, which are more likely to be in for a school you've trained in. Regardless, each book will have at least one new spell, so followers will eventually have access to every spell in the game. Gozag's Call Merchant may create a bookstore, which have a large number of books (~8 each). So by sheer numbers, you are likely to receive a useful book. Bookstores can, of course, spawn in the regular dungeon, where Gozag's funds at least help buy them.

Kikubaaqudgha and Vehumet both provide spells directly instead of via book; specializing in Necromancy or offensive spells, respectively.

Standard books

See also: List of spells by book

  • Book of Decay: Dispel Undead, Martyr's Knell, Death Channel

  • Book of Dreams: Ensorcelled Hibernation, Fugue of the Fallen, Anguish

  • Book of the Hunter: Sigil of Binding, Call Canine Familiar, Dimensional Bullseye
  • Book of Ice: Sculpt Simulacrum, Ozocubu's Refrigeration, Polar Vortex
  • Book of Iron: Summon Lightning Spire, Animate Armour, Lee's Rapid Deconstruction

  • Book of Minor Magic: Magic Dart, Blink, Call Imp

History

  • 0.29
    • Removed Book of Pain.
  • 0.28
    • Removed Book of Stone.
  • 0.27
    • Fixed books now only have 2-4 spells each (down from 4-6 each). Randomly generated spellbooks also have fewer spells.
    • Spellbooks generate more frequently and are always identified.
    • 30 new types of fixed book are added.
    • Mage and Warrior-Mage classes start with spells already in their library, rather than a specific spellbook.
  • 0.25
    • Reworked Book of Enchantments into Book of Hexes.
  • 0.22
    • Spell library was introduced.
      • Spells from books are automatically added to a global library upon pickup.
      • Library spells can be memorized from anywhere through the M screen.
      • Spellbooks are destroyed after their spells are added to the library.
    • Followers of Trog lost the ability to burn spell books on the floor to produce clouds of flame.
  • 0.19
    • Removed books: Akashic Record, Book of Envenomations
    • Books no longer have to be picked up to be identified
    • Removed the ability to forget a spell by destroying a spell book
  • 0.17
    • Removed book: Book of Control
    • High level spell books no longer restrict learning from them based on skill levels
  • 0.16
    • Added books: Akashic Record, Fen Folio
    • Removed book: Book of Wizardry
  • 0.15
    • Removed book: Book of War Chants
  • 0.13
    • Added books: Book of Battle
  • 0.12
    • Removed books: Book of Morphology, Book of Stalking
  • Earlier:
    • Removed books: Book of Tukima, Book of Conjurations (fire+earth), Book of Conjurations (ice+air), Book of Charms, Book of Minor Magic (flame), Book of Minor Magic (frost), Book of Minor Magic (summ), Monster Manual, Book of Brands, Book of Divinations, Book of Surveyances, Book of Practical Magic
